meanings.definition: A person who holds a copy of a document or text.
meanings.sent1: The copyholders in the library carefully read the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: The copyholders at the meeting each had a different version of the report.
meanings.sent3: The copyholders at the party were the only ones who knew the surprise ending of the book.
meanings.sent4: She was like a copyholder of memories, preserving every detail of their adventures.
meanings.sent5: The copyholders in the courtroom listened intently to the lawyer's arguments.

meanings.definition: A device used to hold a copy of a document in place for easy reading or reference.
meanings.sent1: The copyholders on the desks kept the papers organized during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The office supply store sold various types of copyholders for different document sizes.
meanings.sent3: The copyholders on the table were so fancy, they made the documents look important.
meanings.sent4: Her hands were like copyholders, always ready to secure the pages in place.
meanings.sent5: The copyholders with adjustable angles were perfect for reading while standing.
